the essay show I produce...

is a cozy evening of hilarious stories written and performed by 8 of Los Angeles finest men and women, told live at WeHo Church in beautiful West Hollywood!  TUESDAY!  JUNE 10, 2008!  8 PM!

Next Tuesday night!

Chip Pope

Hey.  This is a real special thanks to everyone who showed up last night at "How My Parents Ruined My Life 2" at the WeHo church and to all the freakin' cool ass people who came and made awesome signs during those long days at the LA Sports Arena last week.

I'm going to go nurse my Titan-and-Wolf-inflicted battle wounds and start writing for the next "Parents" show on, June 10.  

In the meantime, I highly recommend buying and reading Robin Benway's new book, "Audrey, Wait."  She is the next big thing.  Seriously.  www.robinbenway.com

Hugs,
Sean

Tomorrow it's all over.  Ashley and KC are in town and tonight we hung out with Kristopher.  it was a high school reunion in West Hollywood because I'm about to go up against the death-defying obstacle course of the summer on prime time TV.  Weird.  the whole thing is just weird.

I feel such a mixed bag of emotions.  I'm sitting in a locker room most days lately with guys from all over the US.  Athletes.  Real athletes who have kids, wives, girlfriends, and whatever else that makes them all-american and straight.  I'm nervous.  Are they embarrassed that I'm here?  Do they wonder what got me on this show?  Are they afraid I'm looking at their dicks?

But they're all really nice.  They stand up for me against those big beefy muscle gods trying to kill me.  One even hugs me on camera.  They give me tips on how to sumo wrestle.  Being the gay athlete doesn't seem to matter in this locker room.  It's nice.

Tonight KC showed me a text from the high school bully that I keep remembering when I go out to compete.  Matt Hansen, upon hearing the news that I've been selected said, "Is this a joke?  Don't they want real athletes?"

Matt said what I've been thinking all along.  I grabbed his number and took my own negative feelings out on his insensitive message when I texted him:

I'm doing this show because of the experiences I had with people like you in high school.  It's disappointing that after all these years you didn't have something positive to say.  I hear your wife is pregnant.  Good luck with your baby.  All the best.  Sean

I'm thinking, probably over-thinking...as one of the producers said.  I would love to win, and though I'm certainly the underdog, a win would be really nice.  Especially now, because of Matt.

I can't let it ruin what a fun night I had tonight.  Besides, I've already won; I got to meet the Hulkster.

My dad called to tell me he's proud of me for not giving up.  I kind of am, too.

It was a horrifying experience that I will never not cringe over.  I was about 8 years old.  I wasn't quite so fat yet. Just kind of queer and uncoordinated.  I was doing something in P.E. class called "Monkey Bars" where you climb across bars, only I couldn't get across the bars.  I wasn't strong enough.  My classmates, including the girls, could all do it.  And my classmates, especially the girls, started cheering for me to get across.  I was so embarrassed beyond belief because I was so physically terrible at all things.  People were being forced to cheer for me, I figured, and that literally gave me hives.

PE class moving forward was a series of being last choice for dodgeball, which I kind of started to relish.  I was usually 5th or 6th to last. There was a slight down syndrome girl who usually got picked after me and an overly-hairy-for-10 guy who had a twitch that was usually last because he couldn't control his farting.  The teacher would allow the picking to be done in front of everyone, boy-girl-boy-girl...then they would get to me and someone would always say, "You can't put two girls after each other!"  RAW RAW...Funny, if you're an asshole.

When I knew I wasn't an athlete I started overeating and watching wrestling.  I wasn't good at football, so I wasn't good for anything.  You grow up in a suburb and don't play soccer and you are invisible.  If your parents can't brag about your baseball prowess, you spend tuesday and Thursday afternoons watching reruns of Punky Brewster.

My mom called my 9th grade PE teacher to tell him that I was physically clumsy and that I'd never learned to throw anything, which my PE teacher announced to all of us 14 year old boys before we stretched.  "Go easy on Hetherington.  He's a late bloomer."  I felt my pancreas, my appendix, my kidneys, and liver all trying to exit my body as fast as they could....

then...

Two weeks ago I was selected to compete for a slot on something so physically out of my realm, I can't believe it.  I went to a boot camp.  I sucked.  I could not dive, I could not tread water.  I could not climb a rock.  I could barely swing sideways on rings.  I was supposed to play fight on a platform with someone holding a padded PVC pipe.  I fell down in 10 seconds.

I had to climb a 15 foot tall pole and swing off of it onto another pole 15 feet away.  it took an average of 8 seconds for the other competitors.  It took me 10 minutes.  Something awful happened as I stood shaking with fear above the ground.  People started cheering me on.  I began to sweat.  i was 8 again.  I wanted to die.  i was right back there in PE.  People being forced to cheer because I'm such a baby.

I was sure I wouldn't be selected to move forward.  The girls were better than me.  I sucked hard, 21 years later. 

Today i went to go be fitted for a uniform to wear because, oh yeah,  I was fucking selected to move forward.  The excess skin from my weight loss is still there, and pushes the spandex out like crazy.  I look like an elephant being given away for Christmas, wrapped in a tiny cellaphane balloon about to pop.  I'm about to compete in front of a very large audience for the next 10 days and then it will be reviewed publicly this summer for the world. 

My biggest fear is not heights or water.  It's gym class.  That's why I became a personal trainer. I thought I could somehow become a weight loss superhero showing people how to be healthy without Mr. Marlette's Badminton coaching and group showering checklist. 

I called my mom to tell her how hard bootcamp is.  She said, "I don't know why you don't let me call these...what did you call them?  Producers? Let me tell them that this is not your strong suit.  I mean, Sean, we took you to Easter Seals to learn how to skip."

But I have learned how to do everything I need to learn for the experience.  I'm not terrible.  And the people in charge call me "inspirational" for my weight loss and career as a trainer.  I'm trusting them this time and have instructed my mother she is not allowed to call ANYONE to make excuses for me.  Nor is she allowed to remind me of how I played T-ball until I was 15.  And I'm also instructing all of my clients that they are not allowed to use the word "can't" when they are in my presence. 

I can't...err...I won't be defeated by my fear of gym class in this case, either.  If there's anything I've learned, it's that gym class was ALWAYS supposed to be fun, anyway.  It's the system that made it suck. And as a trainer, and as a competitor, I have the power to change that...maybe for a nation.

So I'm finally done at CPK.  What a difference a year makes. 

I don't miss it yet.  I'm enjoying my new job of training people and writing for "How My Parents Ruined My Life" full time.  I kind of feel like a doctor in a way.  My clients range from men to women, gay and straight and all of them are trying to lose weight.  They want help and they trust me, and I'm so glad they do.  I'm no doctor, mostly because I care about them all and spend more than 3 minutes with them.  I see myself then and now in each of them.  I'm watching them jump so high and then land wondering how they did it, not really believing their bodies could move with coordination.  It's so much fun to watch!

Money is scary right now.  But it's also really exciting.  It's forcing me to be really careful.  I feel like I'm playing that old DOS based computer game Lemonade Stand where you set a price, mix a recipe, and keep a budget for supplies daily to run a lemonade business in New York City. I'm doing ok with it.  I make coffee at home now. I make lunch instead of...

OH, yeah.  Here's the best part.  Since I left CPK, there's no more midday trips to the fridge to steal bacon.  There's not a mad dash for a triple espresso.  I'm not filled with rage over having to make dressing on the side.  I'm regaining my sanity.   I'm not using food to fill my heart back up when the flourescent lights and 10% tips steal it away.  I'm not counting my hundred dollars a day while eating a full sicilian pizza add mushrooms and chicken, hoping no one is noticing how hard it is to control my overeating.

I wish I had the discipline to just suck it up and deal.  I was powerless over waiting tables.  I know so many people who can work there forever and seperate it all when they go home.  I couldn't.  I don't want to go where my mom and dad did, hating their day job and coming home to brood about it until 10 PM when they started ironing their clothes for the next day.  My anger at work was rooted in my fear.  I couldn't avoid fights with the kitchen manager.  I never trusted the general manager.  Who cares, though?  It didn't matter.  I'm sure they were nice people, but I was wasting so much negativity over the fact that I wasn't doing what I wanted to be doing and taking it out on everyone in my path.

My man says that my energy is completely different after just a couple of weeks.  I think he's right.

Three days before I quit, I asked if he'd sit with me at the La Brea tar pits while I burned my sweat-stained Oxford shirts.  He didn't understand why I needed that.  For me, it was all about making sure I had nothing left to remind me of the experience.  It was so bitter.  Here's how things have changed:  Yesterday, while running around my house preparing for my next client, consulting on someone's home gym, and plannning a hosting gig I have this weekend, I realized the shirts were still in my laundry.  I had forgotten how important it was to angrily and spitefully torch my uniform in a symbolic inferno.  I stopped for a second and thought about it.  If not for CPK, I would not have gotten the hugest gig yet (which I still can't talk about but it's going to be on TV!), I wouldn't have been able to support myself out of living in that damn Herbalife office, and I wouldn't have met my boyfriend. 

I realized then I didn't need to burn the shirts, so instead, I just pissed on them.

Knee is better, training is on.

Up to 12 miles.  Only 14.2 to go.

Still working on a few supplies.

Today is all uphill along Laurel Canyon, 2-4 PM.  Don't be afraid.  My knees are made of steal.  Just ask my boyfriend.

Things to do besides punishing yourself with or without food because you hate your job and feel hopeless about finding a new one:

Write a blog
Hug your boyfriend or girlfriend
Avoid your mother
Do 3 sets of 25 jumping jacks
Make a pot of flavored decaf/overload with Splenda
Listen to "On A High" by Duncan Sheik and just pretend
Go to Al-Anon
Read a book about Borderline Personality Disorder
Upgrade your Netflix membership
1 Word: Ambien
Cruise PerezHilton avoiding stories about people you don't care about like Sienna Miller, Mischa Barton, and Lily Allen
Listen to "Free Your Mind" by En Vogue
Avoid Laundry like its your mother
Read Oprah
Join a message board for the TV show "Dirt"
Call your best friend from high school who is straight, hear about how he never gets laid, and smile
Throw Darts at the mental image of your least favorite coworker, chanting the words "Here's your 50 fucking cents!"
Dust off "Caesar's hard hat GangBang"
Make a top 10 list of your favorite times using weed
Listen to "Touch My Body" by Mariah Carey
Drinka Fresca
Fart
Write that story you've been wanting to tell
Avoid Reality

For about 4 weeks, with the exception of my week in New York, I've changed a habit about myself that I'm so proud of I must tell you.  I'm starting the morning very healthy.

Ok, here's the thing.  I love the morning time.  Ever since I was a kid, my favorite time of day are the 4 hours after I wake up.  I've never been a late sleeper, even when I go to bed late.  I love reading in the morning.  i love showering.  I love exercising in the morning, but most of all, I LOVE breakfast.

I'm not healthy all day, but I like being healthy in the morning because nothing gets in my way in the morning.  The phone is quiet.  The house is empty.  It's great.

After 5 years of being healthy, I know what I need to put in my body to look and feel great, and about 4 weeks ago I started experimenting with how to get EVERYTHING I need for my skin and my soul and my muscles first thing in the morning.  The hard part was developing a morning diet that wasn't high calorie.

I made a smoothie recipe that doesn't taste like a smoothie.  it's a beautiful blue-purple colored, four fucking course meal in a glass with a side 6-ounce cup of high-in-antioxidant flavored coffee, one 8-ounce glass of water, and an 8-ounce glass of my green, white, and yerba mate blend iced tea (email me for that recipe if you want it.)

My skin is clearer and less red.  My energy is better.  My sleep is deeper.  And my ambition is stronger.  

here is my recipe for a PERFECT 554 calorie smoothie called the Sapphire Smoothie that will leave you full until lunch, fill you with fiber and quality proteins, settle the constant guilt and panic over reaching your daily fruit servings, and start your day a tad more joyful.  HINT:  While the recipe is precise, you can cut out the tedious measuring by blending the non-frozen ingredients once a week into a ziplock ready pack.  

BASE:
3/4 Cup Water (0 Calories)  *6 oz toward your 3 quart a day recommendation
1/2 Cup Unsweetened Soy Milk (35 Calories)  *prevents heart disease, low sugar
1/4 Cup (Non Fat Lactose Free Milk (22.5 Calories)  *better for skin and digestion
3 Ice cubes (0 calories) *another 6 ounces of water and thickness toward your smoothie

Fruit:
1/2 Banana (50 Calories) *Eat the other half for another 50 calories so you get to chew something, protects against anemia, high fiber, tastes great
1/2 Cup Frozen Blueberries (50 calories) *It's the best food for you on the planet.
1/2 Cup frozen Strawberries (30 calories) *You're up to 3 servings of fruit now!

Supplements:
2 Teaspoons Flaxseed (15 Calories) *Cheap, increases circulation, replenish skin, tastes better than salmon, high fiber
2 Oz Aloe Vera juice (4 Calories) *Replenish skin, no taste when mixed with fruit, improves digestion
1 Splenda (0 Calories) *who doesn't love sweetness?
1 Scoop Muscle Milk protein (150 calories) TASTES AWESOME.  High in GOOD fats.  high in Fiber.  
1 Scoop Isopure protein (105 calories) *make sure to match protein flavors. I like cookies and cream and strawberry. Isopure protein is the best protein quality in the world.

Extra:
1/2 tablespoon unsalted crunchy natural peanut butter (52.5 calories) *A small portion of natural peanut butter goes a long way.  It's that little indulgence that makes the shake.  Add it at the end.  Nuts are a great source of fiber, protein and love.

I'm serious.  Your skin and your energy when combined with green tea and a cup of coffee will change almost instantly.

http://www.barackobama.com/issues/civilrights/
http://www.hillaryclinton.com/feature/lgbt/

I can't think of a more exciting time in my life for American politics.  As a social minority, watching the constant coverage of the Democratic primaries has been inspiring and validating.  Our focus is on choosing a woman, or an African American, or maybe both, to undo the wrongs of the Conservative non-vision.

What we are finding in this election year is that unlike 2004, so-called "family values" are not as important in choosing a leader.  We have seen that candidates who focus on abstinence, verbal gay-bashing, and trying to reverse abortion laws are terrible with money and worse with fighting terror.  And that's a damn shame for Mormon Bank accounts everywhere.

We need a candidate who already knows that we are all equal under God AND the law and that we have bigger fish to fry then legislating morality.  America finally gets it.  We're talking for the first time in 10 years about Universal Health Care.  We're passionate about bringing 18 year old kids home before they lose another limb, or their precious heartbeat.  We want to stop home foreclosures and raise up the middle class.

And we're trusting the minority profiles we never thought were options in our country in Clinton and Obama.  Either way, as a gay man, I win because I am somehow represented by a leader who bucks the norm and who has promised to have empathy for my struggle per her Vagina or his culturally giant penis.  

And why does a racial and a gender precedent seem so important?

Because unlike 2004, when President Bush threatened to write discrimination into the constitution and we elected him anyway, Americans now have seen what executive discrimination is capable of.  We have a president who has set a bad example for compassionate conservatism.  Hurricane Katrina and all of the death and poverty and destruction that followed has shown us that Republican WASPs are not our compassionate friend, they're actually biggots.   They're our alcoholic grandfathers that forget to tip and love to rage.

I'm so happy to see the homemade signs, the conversations among strangers, OPRAH endorsements, Bill Clinton exhausted from his travels, young people registering, my mom asking me who to vote for...I'm so happy and proud for the first time to be an American and I'm so excited for tomorrow and my first trip to New York to watch it all go down.  

Clinton/Obama '08!

A shame

The Truth.

You have until January 21 to register, change address, or correct problems (I am registered as Mrs. Sean Hetherington, I just discovered) to your California Voter Registration...

Grandma,

How do you know when your fears about life are real and maybe probable, or just imagined irrationally as a way to avoid the complexities of adulthood?  On what day do you decide to go for it and risk it all because you can, instead of wondering if their is just too much evidence telling you no?

When do you see your past as just that: the past, and not likely to happen again...and how do you know that your past didn't exist to prepare you for problems staring you in the face?

How do you know when you're just creating drama and how do you know when you're just trying to protect yourself?

Everything I knew a year ago is different now. My opinions have all changed.  My thinking is no longer black and white.  There is no good and evil, just shades of gray that I was never able to articulate until now.  My dreams are different and my dreads are darker.  I cry now during movies and I'm actually listening to people when they talk.  I'm making eye contact.  I say, "I'm sorry" and I mean it.

I don't hate girls.  I don't think everyone's trying to kill me.  I don't NEED to eat THAT.  I don't feel bad about sleeping pills.  

It's all up side down.  I'm sorting it out now.

I miss you.

I'm ok.  I sound a lot more dramatic than I am.  I'm learning to try not to control my external enviornment so much and work on my internal, as prescribed by OA.  This new way of thinking is just scary sometimes because I'm so used to controling everyone and everything around me, leaving me alone with just a basket of onion rings.  ;)

Love,
Sean

Grandma, 

Becoming a trainer to help people lose weight seemed a lot sexier before I bought my test packet.  Since I've gone to the workshops and started studying, and talked to other trainers...it kind of scares the crap out of me.

I look at these trainers.  Beefcake dudes, many are hot and stupid and I feel two major negative thoughts:
1) This job is for idiots.
2) How can I train people when I don't have a perfect body?

It is so sales-oriented.  And my dad is a salesman, so I have that in my genes, I think.  But I think the people I can really help are the overweight guys and girls who are ready to make a change.  I know them.  I am them.  And here in LA, those people don't really pay for a high end gym membership...obviously.  I never did, either.  So somehow, Grandma, I've got to either learn how to sell to non-fat people WHO MAY EVEN HAVE BETTER BODIES THAN ME (most of them) or walk up to the few fat people at the gyms and say, "Hi.  You are HUGE.  Let's go for a walk."

Is there something shameful about taking people's money to coddle them through bicep curls?

So, what makes me different from the rest of these people?  Well, I did it.  I lost the weight these people want to lose, assuming I work with people who want to lose weight-and I kept it off.  I know how to do it and I want to help.  And any time someone, including myself asks the question, "What makes YOU think you have the balls to train people?" I just have to look at the pictures on my myspace page and note that if I don't put myself out there to help, they may never find help at all.

Thanks for your help.  May I have some pancakes please?

Love,
Sean

I'm sitting in my living room, a wide open space listening to a slow tune by the one and only Reba Mcentire,  "New Fool at an Old Game" and it is cheesy and exactly how I feel.

A kid out of school trying to find my way/but i don't know the rules/teach me how to play/im just a new fool at an old game

Change is everywhere in my 29th year.  My job is about to shuffle, my roommate is moving out soon, I'm discovering OA and had a major breakthrough about my family.  Something has been constant through it all during these last 6 months, and that's my relationship, but even that's new, and especially new for me.  Sometimes, with all the turbulence and excitement around me I get defensive and agitated and start to question my love life. Is this love?   Sometimes there's no turbulence at all, and I'm not used to not living in Chaos, and that's when it seems appropriate to blow a hurricane into my day.

I have this fairy tale check list of what I want in a man, and if the checklist doesn't match up perfectly every so often, I panic.  Is this love?  Am I settling because I'm more judgemental of these people than he is?  EEEEEWW...he did THAT before he met me...sick.  I hope he washed his hands afterward.  Is he a republican?  He didn't laugh at my hysterical joke...he. just.doesn't. get. it.!   He is staring at that guy and he's standing next to me.  What an asshole.  Can't he wait till I'm gone to cruise?  Oh, he's not cruising.  He's trying to get that guy's attention because he's our waiter.  WHY IS HE WEARING A SCARF IN L.A.?

But most of the time the checklist DOES match up, and then sometimes I panic and wonder what to do with the success of our relationship.  Fuck, THIS is love.  I have a white picket fence with him, the kind you read about.  We're perfect together, seriously.  People groan when we cuddle. And that's scary because now people know I'm happy.  I'm making eye contact and being vulnerable.  Shit.  There must be a gas leak SOMEWHERE.   And that makes me wonder, "Do I have the work experience to complete this job? He's a maserati but I learned to drive on a Ford F150.  I'm totally going to get  fired, like that time I got hired to do payroll." Sometimes with just a phrase or a tone, I feel 13 again and really fat and wonder why the fuck I have a lover and I get scared. But I'm not fat (163.2 lbs to be exact, and no sugar or compulsive eating in 56 days!") and I do have a lover...and I'm still a little scared.

And sometimes I want to violently shake him and say, "YOU DON'T REALIZE WHAT A BETTER FUCKING PERSON I AM SINCE YOU CAME ALONG!"  And I want to punch him in the shoulder like a buddy, over and over...then shake him some more and say "YOU MAKE ME SO FUCKING HAPPY AND IT SCARES ME!" Then I want to start biting him and say "I HAVE NO IDEA HOW TO MAKE THIS RELATIONSHIP WORK AND I WISH YOU CAME WITH A WORK BOOK!"  Then I'd start pinching his cheeks really, really hard and ask, "DO YOU MIND IF I FUCK UP A FEW HUNDRED TIMES AND STILL CRASH AT YOUR PLACE!?!?!?!"

But I gotta stay cool, because now he's bleeding.  And that's not love. Or maybe it is.

Dear brother,
I heard you say the other day that Mitt Romney sounded like a decent guy.  I just wanted you to know what he focuses on via his campaign web site, endorsed by him and written by him.  THE VERY FIRST opinion he has regarding American values is about his firm opposition to gay marriage and equal rights where he said that homosexual couples could not raise children properly, followed quickly by his pledge to make abortion illegal and to reduce stem cell research.  He actually testified on a FEDERAL LEVEL TO BAN GAY MARRIAGE BY AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION.

http://mittromney.com/Issues/american-culture

"Last year the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court struck a blow against the family, as I'm sure you know. The court forgot that [traditional] marriage is first and foremost about nurturing and developing children. Its ruling meant that our society is supposed to be indifferent about whether children have a mother and a father."

"I enforced the law that banned out-of-state same-sex couples from coming to Massachusetts to get married. I went to the court again and again. I testified here before Congress for the Federal Marriage Amendment. And I championed our successful petition drive that collected a record 170,000 signatures for a citizen ballot initiative to protect marriage."

When you vote and when you decide who's decent, I just hope you'll remember that anyone who was adamantly opposed to your relationships would not be decent in my eyes and would not get my vote or respect.  :)  That's all.

Love,
Sean

PS While Romney is challenging the rights of Americans, Hilary Clinton is developing plans that benefit ALL AMERICANS. 

http://www.hillaryclinton.com/issues/iraq/ (bringing troops home within the first 60 days from Iraq and offering the most COMPREHENSIVE benefits package and health care to ALL veterans)
http://www.hillaryclinton.com/issues/women/  (as first lady, it was Hilary Clinton who helped pass the family and medical leave act)
http://www.hillaryclinton.com/issues/voting/  (wants to make election day a national holiday)
http://www.hillaryclinton.com/issues/middleclass/   ($50 billion dollar research fund for exploring alternative energies)
http://www.hillaryclinton.com/feature/healthcareplan/ (tax credits for working families, non-discrimination for pre-existing conditions)

Hey Randy,
 
 I bought new shoes today with the help of a running specialist at Arch and Sole.  He watched me walk and all that and I love the shoes.  Took a week off from running, bought a knee strap...went to the doctor who said I should be fine but that I should consider orthotics, and should probably not run a marathon...but anyway, the orthotics I'll probably be fit for next week.  But then went for a jog today and got two blocks before my left knee was hurting again bad, this after a week off from running.
 
 So you know my weight issues, and I'm afraid to not be cardio active, obviously.  I want to take tread class tomorrow but just walk instead of run, so I just wanted to give you a heads up. Maybe you can give me some tips, although I'm afraid you're going to tell me to stop running and that makes me sad to think about.  I want to be like Nancy Kerrigan, or Cool Runnings, or the Bad News Bears or Cher and make a REAL comeback.  Help me, Randy.  help me.  :)
 
 Hugs, 
 
 Sean

Grandma,

This fucking sucks.  I ran the half marathon two weeks ago and then started training for the LA marathon.  My left knee has been in a lot of pain since and I've had to stop running.  My doctor think I shouldn't run the marathon, so I decided I just needed better shoes.

I bought running shoes and a knee brace today after taking 10 days off.  I got less than a kilo away from the house and already my knee is sore again.  I hate this.

I love running.  I can't stop.  Further, it's how I stay fit.  It's a big part of my life, my confidence, my security.  No matter where I go, I always have time and space to put on some shorts and take off.

And now I can't.  I'm scared of getting fat.  I'm afraid I've peaked physically.  I'm afraid I won't be able to run a marathon before I'm 30, you know, like everyone else.

I decided I'll just go lift today instead and try to take the treadmill class as a walk tomorrow, so my trainer can see what I'm doing wrong.  Since I won't wait tables from Friday thru Wednesday, I'll lay up and just hope I get better.  Say a prayer for me. Ask the big guy to help me out if he's not too busy planning the conception of the next Spears child.

Love ya,
sean

Dear Grandma,

I inherited two things from you:

Your mug collection
Your irrational fear that someone might not like you.

Only I realized that when you did it is was because you really felt like you had to work harder to make people like you, probably because you were short.  I did it because I was fat and invisible, but I'm not, anymore.

I process it in different ways, most recently by saying the wrong thing at the wrong time.  Sometimes I meet new people and I'm afraid they will think I'm a deuche bag so I'm quiet or real risky with a joke, or I stutter.  Or sometimes I just say the wrong thing all together.  Like Today at work, a coworker started crying and asked me to make her laugh so I said, "I Have JAUNIDICE inside my WEINER."  She didn't care for that one.  

Last night I met someone at a party, a friend of my boyfriend...real pretty gal.  I said, "Hi."  She said, "OH MY GOD, IT's SO GOOD TO MEET YOU!  WHY HAVEN'T YOU COME TO OUR WRITERS GROUP?"

I felt kind of on the spot, like I don't go to my boyfriends writer's group because, it's HIS writers group, for one.  Second, I've been in writers groups with a lot of women, and it's a lot of whining and child molestation stories and conversations about flow levels and I don't care for those conversations because I don't really flow...and further, grandma, why does every woman I meet, who finds out I'm gay start talking to me like I'm fucking JACK from Will and Grace?  Women go from "He's just trying to fuck me so I'll be an ice bitch" to..."Oh wow he's gay...I wonder if he can hook me up at Crate and Barrell."

Now I'm not saying this girl was DOING that, I'm sure she wasn't in fact...but I was nervous and when I'm nervous I get shy or I make a joke-- so when she asked why I don't go to MY BOYFRIENDS WRITERS GROUP I said..."because I'm a garbage man, not a writer...."

Not the funniest line, I know.  Not even very coherent, probably.  

But I could have responded with, "Because I hate women."  which I don't, but in that moment, kind of did....and i tried to be somewhat cool.

She didn't get my joke, neither did my boyfriend.  I'm not sure I got it, either.  Here I am trying to be fucking charming as fast as I god damn can to get closer to the Sam Adam's tap just inches away, and I stumble and say something awkward.

It turns into a conversation with my boyfriend this morning that's kind of heated, where he says he just wishes I didn't feel so awkward around new people, didn't try so hard, could get out of my head, could seperate being on stage with being off.  I get angrier and angrier that I'm not the schmoozer, the people person he is.  Even though most days I don't have time to return the emails and phone calls I get from friends...because I'm lucky enough to have a lot of friends who know I AM a people person...

And now we're kind of fighting and I feel like a psycho, an asshole, a fat fuck...all because I I'm afraid that this girl thinks I'm not as funny as I should be to be dating her friend.

I'm laying there in bed and I realize the only person who doesn't feel good enough about me is me.  But the boyfriend doesn't give a shit if someone thinks I'm weird.  And if he did think I was too weird to date he'd dump me and I'd find someone who didn't.  But he's ok with it, anyway, so why am I making this into such a big fucking deal?

Because I'm a Hetherington.

I Yam whose I YAM.  I say weird things sometimes.  I'm inapropriate on a rainy day, sometimes on the partly cloudy ones, too.  I think penis jokes are funny.  Sometimes, I forget rules and people's feelings.  I'm also funny and honest and your grandson, and that makes me totally hot.  It doesn't mean I'm not going to try to be a little more adult even when I want to put a whooppee cushion on an uppity casting director's sofa.  I will try.  But when the joke bombs and I get called on it, I'm not going to blame anyone else, nor am I going to fear becoming public enemy number one.  I'm just going to write you a note and tell you, because you think I'm a freakin' genius.  I love making you laugh.

Tell Grandpa that last night I called someone's hometown "The asshole of creation" just like he would have, and it killed.

Love,
Sean

Grandma,

I finally shared this morning in one of these meetings.  We read a story about someone who was handicap and planned her whole day around overcoming her handicap, then realizing she couldn't fix her disability she'd abuse herself with food all night.

I realized that since I've lost weight and discovered my excess skin, I plan my mornings around exercising, taking abs classes, spinning, and weight lifting hoping that I can make it go away.  Then, when my belly is still there three hours later and I start hating myself, I look to the rest of the world--my friends, my boyfriend, roommate, my coworkers, strangers, to validate my body in other ways to make up for the disappointment I feel.  

When that doesn't come, because no one can validate me more than I devalue my own body, I punish myself with food.  Out of fear, I start the same crazy workout over again the next day.  IT. SUCKS.

I keep remembering the story you told me of how you became an alcoholic.  That grandpa would come home drunk and mean and you got sick of feeling it, so you thought, "If I can't beat 'em, I'll join 'em."  It makes me think that in some way, each day I go into things optimistic like you did, and then some crazy asshole steps up to my soul around lunchtime and treats me like shit, so I turn into one also.  That crazy asshole lives somewhere near my earlobe and is a serious retard, but his house is made of brick so he's not going anywhere.

Both you and grandpa found your way out of the drinking before I was born, and I hope I can, too with food.  I continue to use your voice as a shield when that asshole pokes at me when the morning glory wears off.  

It's really nice to visit with you again.  And sooner or later I'm sure the people who see me everyday will appreciate not having the responsibility of validating me...because I'm getting it from you until I learn how to do it myself.

Damn my hair looks good these days.

Love,
Sean

Hi Grandma,

I went back to the gym today to lift a little weight.  I went because I miss it, and because I haven't seen a couple of friends I like to touch base with mostly, but I was also a little afraid of being fat.  I stayed off the cardio and my bumm knee, which sucked but I got a ton of sympathy about it from various acquaintences, which I milked like a prized cow.

I purposely got there at 9:30 since I knew I could only stay until 10:30.  I worked out for an hour.  I ran into a friend who also used to be heavy and told him about how powerless I feel and what I'm doing about it.  He kind of shrugged it away as being just another bad day for a gay man when I told him the story I told you last night.

The weirdest part though, was that I ran into another friend, his ex, actually...and he's always probing into my life...asking me about my boyfriend, my food issues, etc.  He's doing his dissertation right now to become a therapist, and he's also in recovery, so he's not being a dick, he's just really interested.  So I told him what I was doing, also...feeling kind of backed into a corner by his sincere questions.

He was thrilled for me and encouraged me.  We talked as we lifted.  he told me things he's noticed about me, that I work out too much, that I seem discontent with myself. I was glad I wasn't crazy.  We talked about addiction and his struggle...it felt so good.  Someone out there gets it.  More people than I thought.

I left at 10:30 like I said and came back for lunch before work.  I had a turbo tea today but have no plans to go buy them by bulk.  I think I'm kind of over that nonsense, but you know, one day at a time.

I think I decided today that Crunch is a bad place for me right now because I can't stop comparing myself to the V-Shaped muscles that snort coke in the locker room.

Lunch this afternoon was awesome. One small piece of chicken, a bowl of soup, and a sugar-free pudding.  IF I WAS A FITNESS NAZI, I'd say it was 500 calories.  I made myself some homemade iced green/white tea.  Now I'm off to work.  I remembered a conversation we had once while I was in the shower last night.  i want to see if you remember it.  I'll drop a note this evening if I have time.

Love,
Sean

Yo Grandma,

I'm here at the kitchen table again.  I had to eat.  I was hungry.  I wanted 10 pieces of breaded chicken from Trader Joes, each topped with a cheddar and/or pepper jack cheese stick from Gelson's but it's well past 8, which is when eating seems wrong to me in a post 275 world.

I settled for 4 small pieces of chicken and a half stick of cheese on each piece.  If I were a calorie-counting personal trainer/nazi, I'd say it was about 420 calories at about 28 carbs.  But I'm not one of those tonight.  I walked into the house from a meeting wanting to open my sugar-free Jello pudding to eat with a fork while I waited the two minutes for the microwave to cook my chicken, because I.JUST.COULDN'T.WAIT.  But instead, and thankfully, your memory was waiting here for me at the table to play Scattergories or something just like in the old days so I waited patiently and had a glass of water.

The chicken tasted good tonight with the cheese.  I really enjoyed it, and when it was over I got sad because writing a note to you didn't sound as fun as eating the rest of the frozen bag.  I didn't eat it though.  I had one of those puddings and thought about this letter.  I forgot to get a spoon with the pudding, and instead of using my dirty fork out of savage need for sweets, I got up and got a clean spoon because I heard you say it was ok.  But it was something I had to think about, because I wanted that pudding RIGHT NOW.

I wanted to tell you about what happened a week ago when I felt like I was losing my mind.  I was at The Cheesecake Factory with my boyfriend having dinner, because he was hungry.  I had already eaten at work an hour and a half before (an entire chicken tequila fettucini with extra chicken), but I told him I'd go with him to keep him company.  I got a fruity non-alcoholic drink and then a Sprite.  I thought that would make me feel less deprived for having to watch my boyfriend eat, RIGHT THERE IN FRONT OF ME, WHEN I WAS NOT HUNGRY IN ANY WAY AT ALL.

I ended up ordering an appetizer.

I ate half of that and some of his dinner, too.  Then I wanted dessert.

He was indifferent, so I got up and walked to the dessert bar and picked out the raspberry white chocolate cheesecake, thinking the whole time about how i should only have two bites and let him enjoy it--I'd already eaten.

It came and I had a bite, a second, a third...and before I knew it, he said, "I have to hurry because you're going to finish it before I get a bite."

I was horrified, Grandma!  It was my 6th piece of bacon, my third milkshake, my extra serving of syrup, it was all of the indulgences that no one ever notices I take.  It was all of the "please, can I have another?"s that you gave me without asking me if I needed it or if I was even still hungry, cause you didn't give a shit.  It meant I liked your cooking and that you loved me...

only this time...someone was calling me on it, and I desperately need  to keep this a secret, that I'm powerless over food.

No one knows I'm powerless.  I meet people every day who are amazed by my weight loss, who tell me how much better I should feel.  They thrive on my accomplishment; it's even inspired others to do the same.  I've seen it work.  I've found an identity in being a formerly-addicted-to-food-person.  It's why people like me. 

Turns out, I need for everyone to not know this secret about me.  I'm powerless over food.  If I'm not thinking about you, Grandma Ginnie or that I'll be around people like me tomorrow who are also powerless, if I'm not writing about it, or white-knuckling the urge to fucking make myself a TV dinner because I'd rather eat than study or be alone....If I'm not doing these things, I will give in to the urge to eat instead of live my life.

As embarrassing as it is to be a Foodie, I mean, c'mon...there's nothing sexy about being addicted to sugar and carbs.  If Amy Whinehouse was into Red Velvet Cake instead of blow, would anyone care?  Alcohol recovery is kind of sexy, because booze are powerful. And you can be an alcoholic and still be hot.  Look at Lindsey Lohan.  On the other hand, overeaters look like Louie Anderson. 

I'm a fucking joke if I own this.  People won't even believe it.  I'm not fat, so how can I be stashing powerbars in my car in case I'm stuck in traffic for more than 25 minutes and still eating 7-8 meals a day?

I hate that I have to be honest about this, but this is when I turn to you.  You were always honest...always funny...always sweet, too.  I want that...not to be it...just to feel it from you.  I miss you.

Love,
Sean

Hi Grandma,

I'm sitting here in my kitchen writing you a letter, though you've been dead for almost 10 years.  I'd like to think we've both grown a lot in that time, you from 4 feet 11 inches to something taller than the clouds...and me from 275 pounds kid to Border's book Club Preferred Club Card holder.

I'm writing you to ask a couple of favors.  Remember when I was a kid and we'd come to visit, you'd read the bible to me before bed and make me do my prayers on my knees asking God to bless the people around me?  I never wanted you to leave that room so we'd try to bless everyone, including the hummingbirds we'd fed that morning, the feeder that would bring them back tomorrow, your next door neighbor who may have been using crack, your hairdresser who was the nicest black person you'd ever met, and the butcher for having grandpa's ham ready on time so you could make him his favorite sandwich to eat during the 5 'o clock news.

Well that was all I really knew about God as a kid.  That he made the good things happen and all you had to do was ask.  And after he did it you should say thank you if you think of it, but that he kind of already knew you were thankful.  He also kind of knew what you'd ask for, too, so if you forgot to ask--he usually had your back.  The older I got and the further your memory drifts away from me, the harder God has been hiding from me.  Some people think he's a stage manager on FoxNews.  Some think he's looking for a frisky touch in a public bathroom.  Some think he's not even a he, but a she and that he may have nothing to do with Jesus.  Some people think he's a fat Asian guy!

And it's kind of fucking with me.

So I'm in my kitchen right now, and I was affraid to come in here to write this to you, because being near the kitchen is so close to the fridge and the pantry and I skipped abs class today so I'm all nuts right now.  I feel scared and fat and unsettled.  I don't feel hungry but I know that doesn't mean I couldn't eat.  I'm wearing long p.j.'s but that doesn't mean I can't feel frumpy for not having been to the gym in three days.

You never knew me this way, actually.  You only saw me fat and happy and told me how handsome I was.  You thought I was funny and sensitive and sweet.  You saw me asexual and unlimited in potential and though at times you were just some old lady who didn't know her head from her ass, I kind of believed what you thought of me. 

Until I actually became it.  

I'm just about done writing this letter to you and I stayed away from the kitchen.  I'm not hungry nor hateful.  I'm kind of peaceful and relaxed as I get ready for work.  I didn't even ask you my favors yet, and you seem to know what they are.

When i think of God these days, your presence keeps tapping me.  I liked your God as a kid and it took care of me, and since I think you're with Him now, or at least closer than I am considering JetBlue doesn't fly out of West Hollywood yet, I'm going to try to check in with you a little more often and ask for you to help me get through the day without hurting myself with complusive behavior.  I hope that's ok.

And I'm going to cover up the scale and the mirror with you and your various knitting projects because those numbers and images sting like Kerosene sometimes.  I'm going to remember how I used to school you in UNO 22 rounds in a row and then roll my eyes in boredom at your praise of my brilliance.

There will be some shitty moments during this time, but that's when I'll need you most so tell grandpa to "Make his own God Damn sandwich!", just like you did back then.  And if I somehow forget to thank you or ask for help...I hope you'll send me a text or something...

It has been 11 days without a super charge turbo tea and my knuckles are as white as Jack frost.

Actually, I'm fine.  Starbucks has been riding shotgun.

It was four years ago today that I came out to my parents.  

If you haven't done it yet, I highly recommend it--especially on Pearl harbor Day.

Love,
Sean

13.1 miles...1 hour, 45 minutes, 49 seconds.

I'm hours away from my very first ever half marathon.

Four years and three days removed from having lost 100 pounds, I'm getting ready to stand at the start of a course in Griffith park.  This suburb in East LA will lead me down 13.1 miles into Downtown LA, if I don't fall flat on my face, dead on the longest run of my 29 years.

It's like the Royal Rumble, a WWE event where many superstars enter and the ones who last, go onto Wrestlemania.  In my case, can you believe it...I've decided if I'm still standing after the approximate 2 hour race, I'm going to to enter the LA marathon.  My first marathon!  What a dream if I can do it.

It's amazing still that I even believe I can maybe, possibly survive a run like this, when a decade ago I was out of breath walking up the stairs.  I've been eating right...not polishing off pints of Cookies and Cream over fresh baked cookies like I did on the night of my senior prom...for a few weeks...

I'm going to bed early tonight...

I set my plastic WWE Championship belt next to my bed, next to my racing chip and bib...above a banana and a turbo tea...

Wish me luck.

HSBC: $18.00 
NBC Computer: $88.00
NBC VISA : $58.00
Student Loan:  $150.00
Various miscellaneous loans: $60.00

My intention in 2008 is to have my cell phone bill direct deducted from my account at $65.00 each month, and my car insurance at $87.00.

My intention in 2008 is to cancel my crunch membership by march 2008 since I'll be working at a gym full time training people, saving me $69.00 a month.

My intention in 2008 is to have three steady private personal training clients each month to help love their bodies, which will also contribute an additional $900 in income to me.

My intention in 2008 is to do my income taxes in February.

My intention in 2008 is to teach spin class and body sculpting or treadmill class at least twice a week by March 2008 increasing my monthly income by $250-500.

My intention in 2008 is to quit waiting tables by May 11, 2008, my 3 year anniversary with CPK.

My intention in 2008 is to be published again on freshyarn.com, as a way to remind me I didnt move to LA for nothing.

My intention in 2008 is to make $55,000 or more in total income.

My intention in 2008 is to book 1 weekend working on the road doing comedy for pay at $350 or more for the weekend.

My intention in 2008 is to rock the mike on February 23, 2008 and make $250 in ticket sales.

My intention in 2008 is to not tip less than 18% and not more than 20% for any service.

My intention in 2008 is to only buy fruit from Gelsons, the grocery store which is highly expensive yet walking distance from my house, and not household items that are marked higher than Ralphs.

My intention in 2008 is to kick the SUPER CHARGE TEA, saving me $62 a month.

My intention in 2008 is to say "no, that's not in my budget." when something isn't in my budget no matter how much it might make any individual or group judge or hate me, and no matter how much it might interfere with their happiness, because I know that I can't make anyone happier by accruing more debt.

My intention in 2008 is to rescue my credit rating and find joy in this, the way I do in Mayonaise after a long run.

Fat people don't care what they look like when they're fucking.  

C'mon, you've seen big black girls dancing.  They'll grind those rolls up against the hottest guys in the club and leave them begging for more.  They'll cook a sausage under those arms while they're giving a hand job.  They'll open their legs and won't give a second thought to the smell of burned almonds wafting through their thighs.

But once you've lost that weight, if you're so lucky to do so, it's a different story.  There was a time when I was first skinny that I couldn't even go to a club and dance because I saw myself as I did before, a lispy John Candy.  And I still remember the first guy I was ever with.  I kept my shirt on while I blew him.  True story.

That was in December of 2003.  As I approach 4 years on November 29 of reaching my goal weight (under 172.5 pounds) I still have those days where dancing, or bouncing back into a cock, or laying naked with another makes me want to be invisible.

For a long time I satisfied this by masturbation with porn.  i was alone and could see hot guys who couldn't see me.   We all got what we wanted.  Then I added a partner here and there.

I avoided positions where the looser skin would hang and swing back and forth like pork in Chinatown.  I preferred being on my back, especially with a girdle or some kind of small cat laying atop my abdomen, sheilding my shame from the various gentlemen.

I preferred latinos, asians, and blacks because they seemed to appreciate the extra fat as I perceived it.  Also, their English was usually bad and so they didn't ask questions.  This is the shit that goes through my mind when I should be writhing in ecstasy.  My boyfriend now is white, and I never thought I'd be into that.  He'd want to know what it was, why I couldn't always stay hard then, why I couldn't cum without some serious dedication to the craft of cumming.  Because in my mind it was a craft, nearly impossible magic like a ship in a bottle.

I thought he'd never appreciate my need for Barry White CD's or an occasional giggle to lighten this very SERIOUS mood I'd created in bed.  FOCUS.  He's getting louder, so he's close...and you, SEAN HETHERINGTON are still kissing his neck and thinking about how weird it is that you have a penis inside you.  I thought he wouldn't understand how I like it rough sometimes, how sometimes I just need to be talked to like a bitch.  Wait...that part is just for me to hear.

It took months and it's ongoing, really for me sexually to get to the place the rest of the world is.  To me, when someone says, "It's JUST sex" they're missing the point.  My fat ass didn't have it, real sex until I was 27.  I'm a Christian like that...or just a rookie.  Don't get me wrong.  I love sex...I love it too much sometimes...and I LOVE it with the guy I do it with consistently.  My challenge is to get to a place where sex IS JUST sex, where I take it for granted like the rest of the teenage girls in the projects, and I'm close...I'm close...I'm...so...close....FUCK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (pass the cigarette)

If it's true that "Sex is the best a human being can feel physically", then I'm on my way.  Right now, I'm working on the mental part and that's worth the work.  It pays tenfold.  The older I get, the more I love my body and the more I want to fuck myself, and I'll be doing that all day November 29.

I don't buy lottery tickets and I don't play the Lotto.  I'm scared of gambling.  I get nervous when I'm with people gambling like I was as a pre-teen in a mens locker room.  Still I fantasize about winning the lotto.  Like what if I had the winning numbers and I actually played?  What would I do?  This week it's estimated at $34,000,000.  I'd take the cash out option which is $19,500,000.   How would I spend this and save it?

25% goes to the Feds according to the Lotto web site.  That means I'd get a lump sum in 60 days for 14.625 million.

First and foremost I'd call a ticket sharker and get three ringside seats for Wrestlemania 24 in Orlando for me, Kris Haskell and Ryan Dunn on March 30, 2008.  Plus airfare and hotel, that'd be a dream come true at only about $5000.  I'd pay my student loan, credit debt, and all of that bullshit.  That'd cost about $40,000.

I'd get my tummy tuck for $9000.  I'd buy a hybrid Japanese sporty thing like a Nissan Altima.  They're cute and reliable.  That's $30K.  Maybe I'd get a Ford Mustang though instead.  I have a sentimental attachment to that after my last trip home.  Now that I'd be rich, I don't have to care about the enviornment, anyway. Same price.

Ok, then I'd put a dent in some loans and debt that friends have.  I'd anonymously pay their bills.  I'd hold like $200,000 for this.  I'd quit my job for a year and take classes.  Improv, acting, writing courses five days a week.  I'd buy a couple lifetime gym memberships.  200,000 more to cover tuition and fees for all this.  

50,000 a year in living expenses for the next two years also.  I'd only use Charmin.  I'd buy brand name fabric softener, too.  I'd fly once...just ONCE on an airline without boarding groups.

Oh, and I should buy a condo to invest in property.  I'd pay cash since my credit sucks.  I'd want a nice place close to the 10 freeway that didn't need a bunch of work.  Two bedrooms with nice windows.  Here in LA that'd be 1.5 mil.

Oh, I'd buy my parents house for a half million, too.  WAY more than they paid and charge them rent.  Like $7.45 per month.

My bills would be paid...everything...Everyone who helped me survive during these hard years would feel like I appreciated them for all the support they give me.  I'd be on a 24 month schedule to become a star in the comedy world and if it didn't work out, I could still go back to CPk and start over but with a free house and car and a Wrestlemania under my belt.

Oh.  that other 12 mil.  Yeah.  People shouldn't have that kind of money.  Well, people should...but not ONE person who didn't really earn it.  That's Paris Hilton wage.  People with that kind of money invent religions in bathroom stalls over a line of blow.  I want just a little help, then I want to make triple that on my own.  

So instead, I'd give it to charity.  I would.  Seriously.  I'd give it to the faggiest group of under dogs I could find.  I'd start a pFlag under a bridge in Topeka, Kansas with GOLD tables for them to sell pink lemonade and cupcakes.
